entry.title: Sigismund Danielewicz (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Sigismund Danielewicz's (pictured) career in the California labor movement ended after he delivered an 1885 speech advocating against the persecution of Chinese people?

entry.title: Treaty of London (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that unkept promises made in the 1915 Treaty of London created the sense of mutilated victory in Italy after World War I?

entry.title: Bruce Schroeder (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Bruce Schroeder, who presided over the trial of Kyle Rittenhouse, is the longest-serving state court judge in Wisconsin?

entry.title: Walkeria uva (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the colonial bryozoan Walkeria uva is sometimes only detectable by accident?

entry.title: A Place Inside of Me (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the children's book A Place Inside of Me is dedicated to the nephew of Atatiana Jefferson, a Black woman who was shot to death in her home by a policeman in 2019?

entry.title: Sharon Shea (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that New Zealand health executive Sharon Shea points to distrust in authority caused by "post-colonisation trauma" for low COVID-19 vaccination rates of Māori?

entry.title: 2021 lockout (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Major League Baseball set a single-day record with $1.4 billion in new player contracts the day before the 2021 lockout was set to begin?

entry.title: the surgeon of the sidewalks (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that "the surgeon of the sidewalks" is anonymous?
